name: Muslim Association of Puget Sound
mission: PNW Seminary provides a structured program for adults to deepen their understanding of Islamic scholarship and leadership.
theoryOfChange: The Muslim Association of Puget Sound (MAPS) publishes annual reports that outline their strategic approach and measurable outcomes. The 'MAPS ANNUAL REPORT 2024' details their Vision, Strategic Objectives, and Metrics and KPIs. Their vision is to inspire and foster a community that impacts the quality of life and spirituality for individuals, families, and society, guided by the teachings of the Quran and Sunnah. Strategic Objectives include expanding outreach to underserved communities, enhancing technical assistance offerings, and strengthening partnerships with local small businesses. The report also provides measurable indicators, such as successfully engaging over 20,000 individuals for outreach expansion and demonstrating a 75% increase in businesses signing up for technical assistance programs. This framework, with its clear objectives and measurable key performance indicators, functions as a results framework for the charity.

score_details.score_summary: Muslim Association of Puget Sound earns 56/100 due to good alignment and moderate impact (minor risk deductions applied).

all_citations.claim: The organization reported total revenue of $7,286,362 and a program expense ratio of 81.7%.
The association offers various donation options for community members to support its educational and spiritual programs.
The charity holds 17.3 months of working capital and a fundraising efficiency of $0.02 per $1 raised.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization demonstrates strong financial health and efficient operations, though its overall score is moderated by a medium data confidence level and specific religious-cultural alignment.
areas_for_improvement: Limited external data regarding long-term impact metrics for educational graduates
Moderate data confidence levels compared to larger national nonprofits

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization shows high donor fit for those seeking to support religious and cultural causes in the Pacific Northwest [3]. As a sadaqah-eligible entity, it provides a trusted pathway for general charitable giving within the local Muslim community [2].
dimension_explanations.impact: The association maintains a program expense ratio of 81.7%, ensuring that the majority of its $7,286,362 in total revenue directly supports its seminary and daily prayer programs [1]. While the direct provision of services is clear, the impact score reflects a balanced view of its cost per beneficiary and the medium confidence in available performance data [3].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Muslim Association of Puget Sound serves as a vital hub for Islamic scholarship and community leadership in the Pacific Northwest.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 81.7%, indicating most funds go directly to services
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with only $0.02 spent per $1 raised
Strong liquidity with 17.3 months of working capital available
baseline_narrative.summary: The organization provides a structured program through the PNW Seminary to deepen adult understanding of Islamic scholarship alongside daily religious services [1][3]. Based in Redmond, Washington, the association facilitates community engagement through diverse educational programs and spiritual support [2].

alignment.explanation: There is high alignment for donors seeking to support <cite id="2">Islamic identity and religious services</cite> in underserved geographic areas. The organization serves <cite id="2">ibn sabil (wayfarers)</cite> and provides <cite id="2">strong humanitarian services</cite>.

credibility.explanation: Donors can find confidence in the organization's <cite id="3">100% independent board</cite> and its <cite id="3">consistent financial reporting</cite> via Form 990 filings. The organization has also achieved a <cite id="3">Candid GuideStar Platinum Seal</cite> for transparency.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the organization could <cite id="3">publish audited financial statements</cite> and detailed board meeting summaries.

impact.explanation: The impact score is driven by a <cite id="3">direct service delivery model</cite> and a <cite id="3">clear theory of change</cite> regarding Islamic scholarship. However, the <cite id="3">cost per beneficiary is approximately $778.64</cite>, which is average for the religious-cultural sector.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="3">tracking outcomes for 3+ years</cite> and seeking an external evaluation of its seminary programs.

Impact is measured through program delivery rather than rigorous external evaluations

impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: MAPS creates impact by providing <cite id="2">structured Islamic education</cite> and <cite id="2">spiritual services</cite> to foster a knowledgeable and engaged Muslim community.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that educational programs are effectively deepening scholarship as intended.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a <cite id="1">revenue growth rate of 20.8%</cite> and a <cite id="3">$7.3M revenue level</cite>, the organization has a significant funding gap to expand its seminary and community services.

peer_comparison.differentiator: MAPS matches the <cite id="3">peer program ratio median of 81.7%</cite> while maintaining significantly higher <cite id="3">working capital (17.3 months)</cite> than many local peers.

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="3">81.7% of its total expenses</cite> toward its core religious and educational programs.
MAPS maintains <cite id="3">17.3 months of working capital</cite>, providing a significant buffer for long-term operational stability.
Fundraising costs are remarkably low, with the organization requiring only <cite id="3">$0.01 in expenses for every $1 raised</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: The Muslim Association of Puget Sound demonstrates a strong commitment to direct service delivery through its <cite id="2">direct provision model</cite>. By focusing on <cite id="2">daily religious services and the PNW Seminary</cite>, the organization maintains a lean administrative structure. Its financial health is further evidenced by a <cite id="1">revenue growth rate of 20.8%</cite> over three years, suggesting a scaling capacity to meet the needs of the growing Muslim population in the Pacific Northwest. The <cite id="3">100% independent board</cite> provides a layer of oversight that supports its <cite id="3">high accountability standards</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: The Muslim Association of Puget Sound (MAPS) serves as a vital hub for Islamic scholarship and community leadership in the Pacific Northwest, operating as a comprehensive religious and cultural center. The organization manages the <cite id="2">PNW Seminary program</cite>, which provides structured adult education to deepen understanding of Islamic scholarship. Beyond its educational mission, the association facilitates <cite id="2">daily prayers, interfaith advocacy, and community service</cite> initiatives from its base in Redmond, Washington. Financially, the organization demonstrates significant growth, reporting a <cite id="1">3-year revenue CAGR of 20.8%</cite>. Its operational model is characterized by high efficiency, maintaining a <cite id="3">program expense ratio of 81.7%</cite>, which aligns with the <cite id="3">peer program ratio median of 81.7%</cite> for similar religious and cultural institutions. This ensures that the vast majority of donor contributions are directed toward <cite id="2">spiritual and educational programming</cite> rather than administrative overhead. Furthermore, the organization exhibits <cite id="3">exceptional fundraising efficiency</cite>, spending only <cite id="3">$0.01 to raise every $1</cite> in charitable contributions.
